finalproject.utilities

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • finalproject.utilities.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the navigation class which drives the robot from one position on the field to another.
    Author:
    maxsn

      • Navigation

        The public constructor for this class
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • setSpeeds

        public void setSpeeds(float lSpd,
             float rSpd)
        Set the speeds of both motors to a float value.
        Parameters:
        lSpd - The desired left motor speed.
        rSpd - The desired right motor speed.

      • setSpeeds

        public void setSpeeds(int lSpd,
             int rSpd)
        Set the speeds of both motor to an integer value.
        Parameters:
        lSpd - The desired left motor speed.
        rSpd - The desired right motor speed.

      • setFloat

        public void setFloat()
        Float both motors so that the wheels can be freely moved by a human.

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
            double y)
        Move the robot to a specified position on the field while constantly updating its heading.
        Parameters:
        x - The desired x-coordinate of the new position.
        y - The desired y-coordinate of the new position.

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double angle,
          boolean stop)
        Turn to a specified angle theta using the North-South-West-East logic. Angle zero is North, 90 is East, 180 South and 270 West.
        Parameters:
        angle - The desired final heading of the robot.
        stop - Whether to stop the motors at the end of the turn or not.

      • goForward

        public void goForward(double distance)
        Travel a specified distance forward.
        Parameters:
        distance - The distance to travel.
